meanings.definition: Eat or drink greedily or excessively.
meanings.sent1: The hungry squirrel was guttling the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent2: She always guttles her favorite ice cream when she's feeling down.
meanings.sent3: The movie theater offers a guttling challenge: finish the giant popcorn bucket in one sitting!
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like two black holes guttling up all the light in the room.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's face was covered in chocolate, evidence of his guttling of cookies.

meanings.definition: To consume food or drink in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: During the picnic, the kids guttled all the sandwiches within minutes.
meanings.sent2: At the buffet, he guttled plate after plate of food until he couldn't move.
meanings.sent3: The competitive eater was known for guttling hot dogs at an unbelievable speed.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner seemed to guttle up all the crumbs on the floor in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The party guests guttled down the punch as if they had been stranded in a desert.

meanings.definition: To indulge in eating or drinking.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, she likes to guttle on her favorite snacks.
meanings.sent2: During the holidays, it's easy to guttle on all the festive treats.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to guttle on the fresh cream left on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a paradise for birds to guttle on the ripe berries.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread made it hard not to guttle a slice right away.
